title: Effective nuclear charge of Na versus Ne

content.question: The effective nuclear charge experienced by the outermost electron of Na is different than the effective nuclear charge experienced by the outermost electron of Ne. This difference best accounts for which of the following?

choices.label: Na has a greater density at standard conditions than Ne.
Na has a lower first ionization energy than Ne.
Na has a higher melting point than Ne.
Na has a higher neutron-to-proton ratio than Ne.

content.answer: Na has a lower first ionization energy than Ne.

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
